Class MaxHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • MaxHeap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MaxHeapInterface

    public class MaxHeap
extends java.lang.Object
implements MaxHeapInterface
    This is the MaxHeap class. This class is responsible for making a max heap and containing all its various functions such as add, remove, contains, etc. Every method in here will be used in some way by the Engine, which will allow the engine to manipulate the heap however the user may want as long as it is allowed b the program
    Author:
    blayala

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaxHeap()
      Default constructor which will call on the second constructor while passing in the DEFAULT_SIZE
      MaxHeap(int startingSize)
      This constructor creates an array that will represent the heap.
      MaxHeap(int[] data)
      This is the third constructor and it creates a heap using the optimal method.

      returns number of swaps made using optimal method

      • MaxHeap

        Default constructor which will call on the second constructor while passing in the DEFAULT_SIZE

      • MaxHeap

        public MaxHeap(int startingSize)
        This constructor creates an array that will represent the heap. This is the beginning of creating a heap using a series of insertions
        Parameters:
        startingSize -

      • MaxHeap

        public MaxHeap(int[] data)
        This is the third constructor and it creates a heap using the optimal method. It does this by taking in an array of data and inputing it into a un-heaped heap. The reheap method is then run recursively on the heap until the heap is heapified
        Parameters:
        data -
